clinical_study.brief_title: DragONE Study: Acquisition and Maintenance of Paediatric Asthma Control: Usual Care vs Innovative Devices
clinical_study.official_title: DragONE Study: Acquisition and Maintenance of Paediatric Asthma Control: Usual Care vs Innovative Devices

lead_sponsor.agency: Istituto per la Ricerca e l'Innovazione Biomedica

clinical_study.source: Istituto per la Ricerca e l'Innovazione Biomedica

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized clinical trial to assess acquisition and maintenance of paediatric asthma control through innovative devices supporting usual care. In the first study arm, a new application (DragONE) for iOS and Android will be only used for patient monitoring. In the second study arm, a small portable device (SmartONE) will also be connected to the DragONE APP, for daily assessment of the peak expiratory flow (PEF). The study duration is 12 weeks. The main outcome of the study is the Childhood Asthma Control Test (C-ACT) score, assessed once every 4 weeks for 12 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Acquisition and maintenance of the control status

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life in asthma children

secondary_outcome.description: Forced expiratory volume in the first second

intervention.description: The DragONE application for iOS and Android, developed in collaboration with the Institute for Educational Technologies of the National Research Council of Palermo, allow children to daily fill electronically the C-ACT questionnaire and the symptom diary card.
A little portable spirometer connected to DragONE allows daily PEF monitoring.
